thread.title: Girls tennis: Ivenitsky advances to section semifinals
thread.title_full: Girls tennis: Ivenitsky advances to section semifinals

author: J.B. Cozens
title: Girls tennis: Ivenitsky advances to section semifinals
text:
By J.B. Cozens on October 21,   John Jay tennis standout Anya Ivenitsky has reached the semifinals of the Section 1 singles tournament. — J.B. Cozens photo 
Anya Ivenitsky is the lone member of the John Jay girls tennis team still alive in the Section 1 tournament. 
The Indians’ number-one singles player advanced to the semifinals of the section singles tourney by upsetting the second seed, Mayu Tezuka of Keio Academy, in the quarterfinals on Tuesday at Harrison High School. 
Ivenitsky, a senior, rallied from a set down to win the match in three sets, 3-6, 6-1, 6-2. She faces Courtney Ollis of Suffern in the semifinals. Ollis beat third-seeded Emma Lella of Mamaroneck, 6-4, 6-4. 
The top seed, Caitlyn Ferrante of Yorktown, also lost in the quarterfinals, 7-5, 6-3, to Maranda Sears of Arlington. 
Ivenitsky had also gone to three sets to win her first-round match in a marathon, beating Ashley Granieri of Scarsdale, 6-1, 4-6, 7-5. 
The John Jay doubles team of Baily Burke and Tatiana Blechman reached the quarterfinals but lost to the third seed, Laina Campos and Vanessa Ciano of Ursuline, 6-0, 6-2. They had opened the tourney with a straight-set win over Likitha Kumar and Joelle Grady of John Jay East Fishkill, 6-2, 6-0. 
The team of Nadia Shtohryn and Lily Gengler lost in the first round to Devon Wolfe and Dana D’Onofrio of Byram Hills, 6-4, 6-1. Related posts:
